meanings.definition: In poor condition due to age or wear
meanings.sent1: The old chair looked shabby with its torn fabric.
meanings.sent2: The shabby house needed a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat refused to sit on the shabby couch.
meanings.sent4: Her shabby umbrella provided little protection from the rain.
meanings.sent5: The shabby bookshelf collapsed under the weight of the books.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of neglect or disrepair
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had a shabby appearance.
meanings.sent2: The shabby garden was overgrown with weeds.
meanings.sent3: The shabby car sputtered to a stop on the side of the road.
meanings.sent4: His shabby excuse for being late was not convincing.
meanings.sent5: The shabby sign hung crookedly on the rusty gate.

meanings.sent1: She felt shabby in her faded jeans and old t-shirt.
meanings.sent2: The shabby coat had holes in the pockets.
meanings.sent3: He looked shabby compared to his well-dressed colleagues.
meanings.sent4: Her shabby hat was a relic from another era.
meanings.sent5: The shabby scarf kept her warm despite its frayed edges.

meanings.sent1: His shabby treatment of others was unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: The shabby behavior of the bullies angered the teacher.
meanings.sent3: She gave him a shabby look after his rude comment.
meanings.sent4: The shabby lies he told were quickly exposed.
meanings.sent5: The shabby attitude of the customer made the waiter sigh.
